html:
With basically no warning, Kendrick Lamar released his new album, GNX, on Friday, and he caught everybodyâ€™s attention from the jump. On the albumâ€™s first song, â€œWacced Out Murals,â€ Lamar mentions three veteran rappers by name, and each has responded to the name-checks, as Stereogum notes.

First, Lamar raps, â€œUsed to bump Tha Carter III, I held my Rollie chain proud/Irony, I think my hard work let Lil Wayne down,â€ and that led Lil Wayne to post on X, â€œMan wtf I do?!â€ He continued, â€œI just be chillin & dey still kome 4 my head. Letâ€™s not take kindness for weakness. Let this giant sleep. I beg u all. No one really wants destruction,not even me but I shall destroy if disturbed. On me. Love.â€

Next, Lamar says, â€œSnoop posted â€˜Taylor Made,â€™ I prayed it was the edibles/I couldnâ€™t believe it, it was only right for me to let it go.â€ Snoop Doggâ€”who responded, in April, to Drakeâ€™s â€œTaylor Made Freestyleâ€ with some incredulityâ€”took Lamarâ€™s lyrics in stride, writing on X, â€œK dot new album GNX ğŸ’¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ¤ğŸ¤ğŸ¤ğŸ¤ğŸ¤ It was the edibles ğŸ¤¦ğŸ¾ ğŸ˜†ğŸ‘ŠğŸ¿ west west king ğŸ”¥ğŸ¶ğŸ’«.â€

Lastly, Lamar was more reverent of Nas on â€œWacced Out Murals,â€ rapping, â€œWon the Super Bowl and Nas the only one congratulate me.â€ Nas responded today, â€œAlways inspired by my brother KL. Keeping the essence of this shit alive and at the forefront. Salute King!â€

There is one more musician who has a lot to say about GNX despite not being mentioned anywhere on the album, and that is Father John Misty, who, somehow, has, more or less, the same album release schedule as Lamar. After some posts on X (â€œnot now Iâ€™m furiously scribbling my seeming response to,â€ â€œthere goes my #1â€), Father John Misty took things a step further with a â€œdiss track.â€ Itâ€™s not really a diss song, but â€œGodâ€™s Trash,â€ which was recently featured on a Bandcamp-exclusive live album. But that hasnâ€™t stopped Father John Misty from playfully framing it as a Lamar retort. Find his â€œdissâ€ on Instagram.
